skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective Claude Code skills with templates, best practices, and packaging tools.
skill.author: vercel-labs

security_audit.summary: Security audit completed. All 146 static findings are false positives. Network URLs are standard Apache License references. External command patterns are documentation examples using markdown backticks. Cryptographic algorithm flags are triggered by benign 'hash' references in content validation code. Filesystem operations are legitimate skill packaging utilities. No malicious behavior detected.

content.value_statement: Users need guidance on creating effective skills for Claude Code. This skill provides a comprehensive guide for building, structuring, and packaging skills with proven best practices.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through creating new Claude Code skills from scratch
Provide templates and best practices for skill structure and organization
Include scripts for initializing, validating, and packaging skills
Explain skill anatomy including SKILL.md, scripts, references, and assets
Teach progressive disclosure design for efficient context management
Offer workflows for multi-step and conditional skill processes
limitations: Does not execute skill code directly
Does not provide runtime environment for testing skills
Templates require customization for specific use cases
Does not include pre-built skills or domain-specific knowledge

use_cases.title: Building Your First Skill
use_cases.description: A developer wants to create a skill that helps Claude work with their company API. They use this guide to structure the skill properly.

use_cases.title: Organizing Complex Skills
use_cases.description: A team lead needs to create a multi-domain skill with references to finance, sales, and product data. They learn progressive disclosure patterns.

use_cases.title: Packaging Skills for Distribution
use_cases.description: An open-source maintainer wants to package their skill for the marketplace. They use the validation and packaging scripts included in this skill.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name]. I want it to [describe functionality]. Use the skill-creator guide to structure it properly.

prompt_templates.title: Add Skill Resources
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a skill at [skill-path]. Add a script that [describe script functionality]. Follow the skill-creator best practices for scripts.

prompt_templates.title: Structure Multi-Domain Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill with multiple domains: [list domains]. Use progressive disclosure to organize references. Show me how to structure this.

prompt_templates.title: Package and Validate
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my skill at [skill-path] and package it for distribution. Check it follows all the skill-creator requirements.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for processing PDF documents
output: Created skill structure with SKILL.md containing YAML frontmatter

output_examples.input: How should I organize a skill with multiple API integrations?
output: Recommended task-based structure with overview and capability sections
Suggested separate reference files per API: aws.md, gcp.md, azure.md
Included conditional loading guidance for when to read each reference

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise by using progressive disclosure - only include essential instructions in main file, move detailed reference material to separate files
Write frontmatter description with specific triggers - include 'when to use' scenarios, file types, and tasks that activate the skill
Test bundled scripts thoroughly before distribution - run them directly to verify correct behavior
anti_patterns: Including verbose explanations that duplicate what Claude already knows - only add context the model lacks
Creating unnecessary documentation files like README.md or QUICK_REFERENCE.md that add clutter
Failing to reference bundled resources from SKILL.md - Claude needs to know files exist and when to read them

faq.question: What is a skill in Claude Code?
faq.answer: A skill is a modular package that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, and tools. It acts as an onboarding guide for specific domains or tasks.

faq.question: What files are required in a skill?
faq.answer: Every skill requires a SKILL.md file with YAML frontmatter containing name and description fields. Optional bundled resources include scripts/, references/, and assets/ directories.

faq.question: How do I initialize a new skill?
faq.answer: Run the init_skill.py script with your skill name and output path. It generates a template with proper structure and example files that you can customize.

faq.question: What is progressive disclosure?
faq.answer: Progressive disclosure is a design pattern where only essential information loads initially. Detailed reference material loads only when Claude determines it is needed, saving context window space.

faq.question: How do I package a skill for distribution?
faq.answer: Run package_skill.py with your skill folder path. The script validates the skill structure first, then creates a .skill file (zip archive) for distribution.

faq.question: What are the naming conventions for skills?
faq.answer: Skill names must use hyphen-case (lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens only). They cannot start or end with a hyphen or contain consecutive hyphens. Maximum length is 64 characters.
